It'll be a sad night in Harlem this
Thanksgiving. To use the immortal
idiom, "there'll be turkey and trimmings and reefers and rum"; but
there has passed away a glory from
the earth. The sedge has withered
the lake, and no birds sing. In
short there'll be no hi-de-ho. For
Claude Hopkins has gone to Baltimore.
